intro: Moraea algoensis, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, upright stem. Moraea algoensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
